DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , randomize study blind outcome assessment , compare routine manual thrombus aspiration aspiration patient acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) undergo percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . Patients diagnose STEMI refer PCI enrol . They randomize 1:1 either manual thrombus aspiration PCI group PCI alone group.The primary outcome composite cardiovascular death , recurrent myocardial infarction ( MI ) , cardiogenic shock , stroke , new worsen NYHA class IV heart failure 1 year follow-up . The secondary efficacy outcome stent thrombosis , target vessel revascularization , leave ventricular function quality life 1 year follow-up .
DOC.criteria: Age 1880 ; Diagnosed STEMI present symptom definite ECG myocardial marker change ; Patients present definite ECG change indicate STEMI : ST elevation 0.1 mV 2 contiguous limb lead ≥0.2 mV 2 contiguous precordial lead ; Referred PCI presenting symptom , coronary angiogram ( CAG ) show initial TIMI thrombus grade ≥2 ; Informed consent . Previous history myocardiopathy , valvular heart disease severe heart failure ; Severe hepatic renal dysfunction ; Life expectancy less 1 year ; Prior PCI CABG ; Contraindications use anticoagulation antiplatelet drug .
